title: Skia Version 70
body:
Hey, when will SkiaSharp upgrade to Skia version 70?

Currently SkiaSharp is using skia version 60 which was released around July 2017 (more than a year ago). There has been lots of improvements made in the last ten versions.

Skia version 71 will be released in few weeks: https://skia.org/schedule

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
We are currently working on getting a new 68 release out very soon. This is currently in the [`development` branch](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/tree/development).

Even though Google releases a "stable" release, we have found that it is not usually not up the the "stable" standard that we would like. It will often recieve changes multiple times a week. As a result, we have decided to follow the slightly slower release of the Chrome release.

Skia is released at an "alpha" level and used by the preview builds of Chrome. We found that following behind by 3 releases results in a much more stable product. We are working with Google, so any critical bugfixes have been merged back far enough.

As of this comment, m70 has been released, that means we want to release m68 as the latest.

We have switched to an improved CI system, so we are working on getting a new "nightly" build out so that you can follow the updates as they come.
